body.head: Johann Strauß, younger (born Vienna, Oct 25, 1825; died Vienna, June 3, 1899)

div.p: Johann Strauß, younger (born Vienna, Oct 25, 1825; died Vienna, June 3, 1899), Austrian composer, nicknamed the "Waltz King"; also conductor and violinist. He composed a large amount of dance music, including quadrilles, galops, and marches, but is best known for his waltzes, such as the "Blue Danube Waltz" (An der schönen blauen Donau) and "Tales of the Vienna Woods" (Geschichten aus dem Wiener Wald). Of equal importance were his many operettas, of which Die Fledermaus (1874) and The Gipsy Baron (Der Zigeunerbaron) (1885) are among the most famous.
